launched.description: When this contract is launched, this is set to the block time.

token_addr.description: The SNIP20 token contract that will be managed by this instance.

token_hash.description: The code hash of the managed contract (see `secretcli query compute contract-hash --help`).

Account.description: Individual vesting config. Immediate release is thought of as a special case of vesting where: * `head == total` * `duration == interval == 0`, * only `head_allocations` is considered.

amount.description: Funds that this account will release

cliff.description: If `> 0`, releases this much money the first time, pushing back the regular portions

duration.description: If `> 0`, vesting stops after this much seconds regardless of how much is left of `total`.

interval.description: How many seconds to wait between portions

start_at.description: How many seconds after contract launch to begin vesting

LinearMap_for_HumanAddr_and_Uint128.description:
Just a wrapped `Vec` with `get` and `insert` methods.

Acts as a KV map but serializes as an array of [K,V] pairs: * new keys are appended to the end, existing keys are updated in place * there is no check for keys being unique during deserialization * in case of duplicate keys, it's the 1st instance of a given key that "counts".

It's like this because `serde_json_wasm` doesn't serialize maps (`HashMap`, `BTreeMap`). This is true even in even in versions more recent than the default for SecretNetwork: the `serialize_map` method contains a single `unreachable!()` panic. It's not immediately obvious why this remains the case the case; perhaps iterating over of those is somehow more expensive on a blockchain? In any case, in the absence of gas benchmarks it's pointless to risk altering the default execution environment (of which `serde_json_wasm` is part), even though there's no obvious reason why that wouldn't work.

Pool.description: Subdivision of `Schedule`, contains `Account`s, may be `partial`. If `partial == false`, they must add up to `total`.

partial.description: if `true`, adding new `Account`s is allowed at runtime, up to `total`. otherwise, accounts must add up to `total` at creation.

Schedule.description: Contains `Pool`s that must add up to `total`.
